00034 void define_dumppgf_options(PgOptions* opts) {
00035   opts->setUsage("apt-dump-pgf - Dump information from a pgf file.\n"
00036                  "Usage:\n"
00037                  "   apt-dump-pgf -o int.txt -c file.clf -p file.pgf [--probeset-type=type [--probeset-type=...]]\n\n"
00038                  "   apt-dump-pgf -o int.txt -c file.clf -p file.pgf [--probeset-ids=file [--probeset-ids=...]]\n\n"
00039                  "   apt-dump-pgf -o int.txt -c file.clf -p file.pgf [--probe-ids=file [--probe-ids=...]]"
00040                  );
00041   opts->defineOption("p", "pgf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00042                      "The pgf file used to dump information.",
00043                      "");
00044   opts->defineOption("c", "clf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00045                      "Optional clf file to use. When present, "
00046                      "probe position will be included in the output.",
00047                      "");
00048   opts->defineOption("", "probeset-only", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00049                      "Dump only probeset level information.",
00050                      "false");
00051   opts->defOptMult("", "probeset-type", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00052                    "Optional probeset type to extract; "
00053                    "can be specified multiple times. When specified "
00054                    "multiple times, the intersection of all types "
00055                    "is taken. The user cannot mix use of probeset-type, "
00056                    "probeset-ids, and probe-ids.",
00057                    "");
00058   opts->defineOption("s", "probeset-ids", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00059                      "Optional name of a file containing probeset ids "
00060                      "to extract; can be specified multiple times. The "
00061                      "user cannot mix use of probeset-type, probeset-ids, "
00062                      "and probe-ids.",
00063                      "");
00064   opts->defineOption("", "probe-ids", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00065                      "Optional name of a file containing probe ids "
00066                      "to extract; can be specified multiple times. The "
00067                      "user cannot mix use of probeset-type, probeset-ids, "
00068                      "and probe-ids.",
00069                      "");
00070   opts->defineOption("", "or", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00071                      "Use the union of the types requested, not the intersection.",
00072                      "false");
00073   opts->defineOption("o", "out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00074                      "Output file to contain the dump output.",
00075                      "");
00076   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00077                      "Display version information.",
00078                      "false");
00079   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00080                      "Print help message.",
00081                      "false");
00082 }
00083 
00095 dumpPgf::dumpPgf (const char* argv[], 
00096                   const std::string& version,
00097                   const std::string& cvsId)
00098   : m_Version (version), m_CvsId (cvsId), m_GetProbeCoordinates (0)
00099 {
00100   // Prefer throw() to exit().
00101   Err::setThrowStatus (true);
00102 
00103   //
00104   //m_Opts = new PgOptions ();
00105   define_dumppgf_options(&m_Opts);
00106   m_Opts.parseArgv(argv);
00107 
00108   // The command line is copied to output.
00109   m_CommandLine=m_Opts.commandLine();
00110 
00111   // Optionally display usage message.
00112   if (m_Opts.getBool("help") || (m_Opts.argc() <= 1))
00113   {
00114     m_Opts.usage();
00115     cout << "version:\n" << "   " << version << "\n";
00116     cout << "   " << cvsId;
00117     exit(0);
00118   }
00119   // Optionally display version.
00120   if (m_Opts.getBool("version"))
00121   {
00122     cout << "version: " << version << "   " << cvsId;
00123     exit(0);
00124   }
00125 
00126   // Require pgf file.
00127   m_PgfFileName = m_Opts.get("pgf-file");
00128   if (m_PgfFileName.empty())
00129   {
00130     string msg = "Must provide pgf file.";
00131     Err::errAbort (msg);
00132   }
00133   // Optional clf file.
00134   m_ClfFileName = m_Opts.get("clf-file");
00135 
00136   PgOpt* opt;
00137 
00138   // Save optional types.
00139   opt = m_Opts.mustFindOpt("probeset-type");
00140   opt->push_user_values_into(m_ProbesetTypes);
00141   // Save optional probeset
00142   opt = m_Opts.mustFindOpt("probeset-ids");
00143   opt->push_user_values_into(m_ProbesetIdFileNames);
00144   // and probe id file names.
00145   opt = m_Opts.mustFindOpt("probe-ids");
00146   opt->push_user_values_into(m_ProbeIdFileNames);
00147 
00148   // Allow only one of probeset-type, probeset-ids, or probe-ids options.
00149   int optionsChosen = 0;
00150   optionsChosen += m_ProbesetTypes.empty() ? 0 : 1;
00151   optionsChosen += m_ProbesetIdFileNames.empty() ? 0 : 1;
00152   optionsChosen += m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty() ? 0 : 1;
00153 
00154   if (optionsChosen > 1)
00155   {
00156     string msg = "Cannot mix use of --probeset-ids, --probe-ids, ";
00157     msg += "and --probeset-type.";
00158     Err::errAbort (msg);
00159   }
00160 
00161   // Save optional probeset-only, or flags.
00162   m_DumpProbesetsOnly = m_Opts.getBool("probeset-only");
00163   m_DumpUnion = m_Opts.getBool("or");
00164 
00165   // Probeset-only is incompatible with a probe-ids list.
00166   if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly && !m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty())
00167     Err::errAbort ("Cannot use --probeset-only with --probe-ids.");
00168 
00169   // Output to cout unless a writeable file was selected.
00170   m_Outfile = m_Opts.get("out-file");
00171   if (m_Outfile.empty())
00172     Err::errAbort ("Must provide an output file, --out-file option.");
00173   else
00174   {
00175     Util::mustOpenToWrite (m_FileOut, m_Outfile);
00176     m_Out = &m_FileOut;
00177   }
00178 
00179 
00180 }
00181 
00187 void dumpPgf::run()
00188 {
00189   // Write initial output.
00190   beginOutput();
00191 
00192   // Read optional probeset or probe id files.
00193   readIdFiles();
00194 
00195   // Open input files.
00196   openInputFiles();
00197 
00198   // Write output header.
00199   writeOutputHeader();
00200 
00201   // Write lines matching selection criteria.
00202   writeMatches();
00203 }
00204 
00208 void dumpPgf::readIdFiles()
00209 {
00210   // Probeset id file(s).
00211   map <int, bool> probesetIdsMap;
00212   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbesetIdFileNames.size(); ++i)
00213   {
00214     string& probesetIdFileName = m_ProbesetIdFileNames[i];
00215     TsvFile tsv;
00216     int probesetId;
00217     tsv.bind (0, "probeset_id", &probesetId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00218     if (tsv.open (probesetIdFileName) != TSV_OK)
00219       Err::errAbort ("Problem opening probeset id file " + probesetIdFileName);
00220     while (tsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00221       // Ignore duplicate ids.
00222       if (probesetIdsMap.insert (make_pair (probesetId, true)) .second)
00223         m_ProbesetIds.push_back (probesetId);
00224     tsv.close();
00225   }
00226   Verbose::out(1,"Found " + ToStr(m_ProbesetIds.size()) + " probesets in probeset list files.");
00227   // Probe id file(s).
00228   map <int, bool> probeIdsMap;
00229   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbeIdFileNames.size(); ++i)
00230   {
00231     string& probeIdFileName = m_ProbeIdFileNames[i];
00232     TsvFile tsv;
00233     int probeId;
00234     tsv.bind (0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00235     if (tsv.open (probeIdFileName) != TSV_OK)
00236       Err::errAbort ("Problem opening probe id file " + probeIdFileName);
00237     while (tsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00238       // Ignore duplicate ids.
00239       if (probeIdsMap.insert (make_pair (probeId, true)) .second)
00240         m_ProbeIds.push_back (probeId);
00241     tsv.close();
00242   }
00243   Verbose::out(1,"Found " + ToStr(m_ProbeIds.size()) + " probes in probe list files.");
00244 }
00245 
00249 void dumpPgf::beginOutput()
00250 {
00251     Verbose::out(1,"MODULE: " + m_Version + " " + m_CvsId);
00252     Verbose::out(1,"CMD: " + m_CommandLine);
00253     m_ExecGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00254     Verbose::out(1,"exec_guid " + m_ExecGuid);
00255 }
00256 
00263 void dumpPgf::openInputFiles()
00264 {
00265     Verbose::out(1,"Reading meta data from PGF and CLF files");
00266   // Open pgf file.
00267   m_PgfTsv.bind (0, "probeset_id", &m_PgfProbesetId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00268   if (! m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00269     m_PgfTsv.bind (2, "probe_id", &m_PgfProbeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00270   if (m_PgfTsv.open (m_PgfFileName) != TSV_OK)
00271     Err::errAbort ("Problem opening file " + m_PgfFileName + ".");
00272 
00273   // If a clf file name was provided, open it.
00274   if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00275   {
00276     if (m_ClfTsv.open (m_ClfFileName) != TSV_OK)
00277       Err::errAbort ("Problem opening file " + m_ClfFileName + ".");
00278     if (m_SequentialClf.isSequential (m_ClfTsv))
00279       // If sequential, calculate coordinates by simple arithmetic.
00280       m_GetProbeCoordinates = &dumpPgf::getCoordsBySequentialClf;
00281     else
00282     {
00283       // Not sequential, use index to find coordinates.
00284       // Require probe_id, x, y columns.
00285       m_ClfTsv.bind (0, "probe_id", &m_ClfProbeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00286       m_ClfTsv.bind (0, "x", &m_ClfX, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00287       m_ClfTsv.bind (0, "y", &m_ClfY, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00288       // Will be indexing over probe_id.
00289       m_ClfTsv.defineIndex (0, "probe_id", TSV_INDEX_INT, 0);
00290       m_GetProbeCoordinates = &dumpPgf::getCoordsByIndex;
00291     }
00292   }
00293 
00294   // If probeset-ids file(s) were provided, index over probeset_id.
00295   if (! m_ProbesetIdFileNames.empty())
00296     m_PgfTsv.defineIndex (0, "probeset_id", TSV_INDEX_INT, 0);
00297   // Likewise for probe ids - already required that the user did not request both.
00298   if (! m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty())
00299     m_PgfTsv.defineIndex (2, "probe_id", TSV_INDEX_INT, 0);
00300 
00301   // Set up output header, bind pgf file data.
00302   m_ProbesetDataCount = m_PgfTsv.getColumnCount(0);
00303   // Save probeset level data other than the probeset_id (int)
00304   // as strings.
00305   m_ProbesetData.resize (m_ProbesetDataCount - 1);
00306   unsigned int k = 0;
00307   bool foundType = false;
00308   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbesetDataCount; ++i)
00309   {
00310     string colName;
00311     m_PgfTsv.cidx2cname (0, i, colName);
00312     m_OutputColNames.push_back (colName);
00313     // Probeset_id is an int, type and probeset_name are strings.
00314     // To make generating output simpler, require that the
00315     // first column is the probeset_id.
00316     assert (! ((i == 0) && (colName != "probeset_id")) );
00317     if (colName != "probeset_id")
00318     {
00319       if (colName == "type")
00320       {
00321         m_ProbesetTypeCol = k;
00322         foundType = true;
00323       }
00324       m_PgfTsv.bind (0, i, &m_ProbesetData[k++]);
00325     }
00326   }
00327   // Subtract probeset_id column from data count.
00328   --m_ProbesetDataCount;
00329   // Require type column if user requested -probeset-type.
00330   if (! m_ProbesetTypes.empty() && ! foundType)
00331     Err::errAbort ("No type column in pgf file");
00332   // Bind atom, probe level data unless -probeset-only selected.
00333   if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00334     m_AtomDataCount = m_ProbeDataCount = 0;
00335   else
00336   {
00337     m_AtomDataCount = m_PgfTsv.getColumnCount(1);
00338     m_ProbeDataCount = m_PgfTsv.getColumnCount(2);
00339     // Save atom and probe level data other than the probe_id (int)
00340     // as strings.
00341     m_AtomProbeData.resize (m_AtomDataCount + m_ProbeDataCount - 1);
00342     k = 0;
00343     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_AtomDataCount; ++i)
00344     {
00345       string colName;
00346       m_PgfTsv.cidx2cname (1, i, colName);
00347       m_OutputColNames.push_back (colName);
00348       m_PgfTsv.bind (1, i, &m_AtomProbeData[k++]);
00349     }
00350     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbeDataCount; ++i)
00351     {
00352       string colName;
00353       m_PgfTsv.cidx2cname (2, i, colName);
00354       m_OutputColNames.push_back (colName);
00355       // Again, to make generating output simpler, require that
00356       // the first probe level column is the probe_id.
00357       assert (! ((i == 0) && (colName != "probe_id")) );
00358       // Already bound probe_id.
00359       if (colName != "probe_id")
00360         m_PgfTsv.bind (2, i, &m_AtomProbeData[k++]);
00361     }
00362     // Subtract probe_id column from data count.
00363     --m_ProbeDataCount;
00364     // If using a clf file, will write x and y columns.
00365     if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00366     {
00367       m_OutputColNames.push_back ("x");
00368       m_OutputColNames.push_back ("y");
00369     }
00370   } // end if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00371 }
00372 
00376 void dumpPgf::writeOutputHeader()
00377 {
00378   // Generic apt meta tags.
00379   const string guid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00380   *m_Out << "#%guid=" << guid << "\n";
00381   *m_Out << "#%exec_guid=" << m_ExecGuid << "\n";
00382   *m_Out << "#%exec_version=" << m_Version << " " << m_CvsId << "\n";
00383   *m_Out << "#%create_date=" << Util::getTimeStamp() << "\n";
00384   *m_Out << "#%cmd=" << m_CommandLine << "\n";
00385 
00386   // Copy genome position file header meta tags to output.
00387   string key, value;
00388   m_PgfTsv.headersBegin();
00389   while (m_PgfTsv.headersNext (key, value) == TSV_OK)
00390     // Propagate only chip_type, lib_set_version, and lib_set_name.
00391     if ( (key == "chip_type") || (key == "lib_set_version") ||
00392         (key == "lib_set_name") )
00393       *m_Out << "#%" << key << "=" << value << "\n";
00394 
00395   // Write header line.
00396   unsigned int colNameCount = m_OutputColNames.size();
00397   assert (colNameCount > 0);
00398   *m_Out << m_OutputColNames[0];
00399   for (unsigned int i = 1; i < colNameCount; ++i)
00400     *m_Out << "\t" << m_OutputColNames[i];
00401   *m_Out << "\n";
00402 }
00403 
00407 void dumpPgf::writeMatches()
00408 {
00409   // If using a clf file, need a method for obtaining probe coordinates.
00410   if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00411     assert (m_GetProbeCoordinates);
00412 
00413   // Indexing probesets.
00414   if (! m_ProbesetIdFileNames.empty())
00415   {
00416     const unsigned int probesetIdCount = m_ProbesetIds.size();
00417     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < probesetIdCount; ++i)
00418     {
00419       if(i==0)
00420           Verbose::out(1,"Indexing probesets in PGF file");
00421       const int probesetId = m_ProbesetIds[i];
00422       if (m_PgfTsv.findBegin (0, "probeset_id", TSV_OP_EQ, probesetId) != TSV_OK)
00423         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00424       const int resultCount = m_PgfTsv.findResultsCount();
00425       // Skip if no match.
00426       if (resultCount == 0)
00427         continue;
00428 
00429       // Fatal error if more than one match was found.
00430       else if (resultCount > 1)
00431       {
00432         string msg = "probeset_id '" + ToStr (probesetId);
00433         msg += "' is not a unique index. Duplicate probeset_id found, [";
00434         msg += ToStr (probesetId) + "] for pgf file " + m_PgfFileName;
00435         Err::errAbort (msg);
00436       }
00437       // Found one match - read, write data.
00438       if (m_PgfTsv.findNext() != TSV_OK)
00439         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00440       if(i==0)
00441         Verbose::out(1,"Dumping probeset info");
00442       dumpProbesetData();
00443     }
00444   }
00445 
00446   // Indexing probes.
00447   else if (! m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty())
00448   {
00449     const unsigned int probeIdCount = m_ProbeIds.size();
00450     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < probeIdCount; ++i)
00451     {
00452       const int probeId = m_ProbeIds[i];
00453       if(i==0)
00454         Verbose::out(1,"Indexing probes in PGF file");
00455       if (m_PgfTsv.findBegin (2, "probe_id", TSV_OP_EQ, probeId) != TSV_OK)
00456         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00457       const int resultCount = m_PgfTsv.findResultsCount();
00458       // Skip if no match.
00459       if (resultCount == 0)
00460         continue;
00461 
00462       // Fatal error if more than one match was found.
00463       else if (resultCount > 1)
00464       {
00465         string msg = "probe_id '" + ToStr (probeId);
00466         msg += "' is not a unique index. Duplicate probe_id found, [";
00467         msg += ToStr (probeId) + "] for pgf file " + m_PgfFileName;
00468         Err::errAbort (msg);
00469       }
00470       // Found one match - read, write data.
00471       if (m_PgfTsv.findNext() != TSV_OK)
00472         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00473       if(i==0)
00474         Verbose::out(1,"Dumping probe info");
00475       dumpProbeData();
00476     }
00477   }
00478 
00479   // Dumping by probeset type.
00480   else if (! m_ProbesetTypes.empty())
00481   {
00482     Verbose::out(1,"Scanning PGF file probe for requested type(s)");
00483     const vector<string>::const_iterator userTypesBegin = m_ProbesetTypes.begin();
00484     const vector<string>::const_iterator userTypesEnd = m_ProbesetTypes.end();
00485     const unsigned int userTypesCount = m_ProbesetTypes.size();
00486     // Types in line read from pgf file.
00487     vector<string> pgfFileTypes;
00488     // User entered -or.
00489     if (m_DumpUnion)
00490       while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00491       {
00492         // Split type by '->'.
00493         splitTypes (m_ProbesetData[m_ProbesetTypeCol], pgfFileTypes);
00494         // Dump this probeset_id if pgf file type matches any of those specified by the user.
00495         const unsigned int pgfFileTypesCount = pgfFileTypes.size();
00496         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < pgfFileTypesCount; ++i)
00497           if (find (userTypesBegin, userTypesEnd, pgfFileTypes[i]) != userTypesEnd)
00498           {
00499             dumpProbesetData();
00500             break;
00501           }
00502       } // end while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00503     // Default 'and' - require pgf file types to include all of those specified by the user.
00504     else
00505       while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00506       {
00507         splitTypes (m_ProbesetData[m_ProbesetTypeCol], pgfFileTypes);
00508         const vector<string>::const_iterator pgfFileTypesBegin = pgfFileTypes.begin();
00509         const vector<string>::const_iterator pgfFileTypesEnd = pgfFileTypes.end();
00510         bool noMismatchFound = true;
00511         // Dump this probeset_id if type matches all of those specified by the user.
00512         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < userTypesCount; ++i)
00513         {
00514           if (find (pgfFileTypesBegin, pgfFileTypesEnd, m_ProbesetTypes[i]) == pgfFileTypesEnd)
00515           {
00516             // If one of the user requested types is not present in this pgf file line,
00517             // don't write the line.
00518             noMismatchFound = false;
00519             break;
00520           }
00521         }
00522         if (noMismatchFound)
00523           dumpProbesetData();
00524       } // end while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00525   }
00526 
00527   // None of the above - dump the entire pgf file.
00528   else
00529   {
00530     Verbose::out(1,"Dumping entire PGF file");
00531     while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00532       dumpProbesetData();
00533   }
00534 }
00535 
00539 void dumpPgf::splitTypes (const std::string& inputString, std::vector<std::string>& inputTypes)
00540 {
00541   // Want to reuse the output vector; clear it first.
00542   inputTypes.clear();
00543   size_t substrBegin = 0;
00544   for (;;)
00545   {
00546     size_t substrEnd = inputString.find ("->", substrBegin);
00547     if (substrEnd == string::npos)
00548     {
00549       // No more '->' - save what's left, quit.
00550       string subString = inputString.substr (substrBegin);
00551       // Avoid returning a null string from a terminating '->' or an empty inputString.
00552       if (! subString.empty())
00553         inputTypes.push_back (subString);
00554       break;
00555     }
00556     // Avoid null strings from an initial '->' or '->->'.
00557     if (substrEnd != substrBegin)
00558       inputTypes.push_back (inputString.substr (substrBegin, substrEnd - substrBegin) );
00559     // Continue following the '->'
00560     substrBegin = substrEnd + 2;
00561   }
00562 }
00563 
00567 void dumpPgf::dumpProbesetData()
00568 {
00569   // If dumping probesets only, write out data.
00570   if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00571   {
00572     *m_Out << m_PgfProbesetId;
00573     for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_ProbesetDataCount; ++j)
00574       *m_Out << "\t" << m_ProbesetData[j];
00575     *m_Out << "\n";
00576     return;
00577   }
00578   // Read, dump atom, probe level data.
00579   while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (1) == TSV_OK)
00580     while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (2) == TSV_OK)
00581       dumpProbeData();
00582 }
00583 
00587 void dumpPgf::dumpProbeData()
00588 {
00589   *m_Out << m_PgfProbesetId;
00590   for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_ProbesetDataCount; ++j)
00591     *m_Out << "\t" << m_ProbesetData[j];
00592   // Keeping atom, probe level data, excluding probe_id, in
00593   // the m_AtomProbeData vector.
00594   unsigned int k = 0;
00595   for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_AtomDataCount; ++j)
00596     *m_Out << "\t" << m_AtomProbeData[k++];
00597   // Previously required that the probe_id column be
00598   // first in the probe level data.
00599   *m_Out << "\t" << m_PgfProbeId;
00600   for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_ProbeDataCount; ++j)
00601     *m_Out << "\t" << m_AtomProbeData[k++];
00602   // Dump x, y columns if a clf file is in use.
00603   if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00604   {
00605     (this->*m_GetProbeCoordinates) (m_PgfProbeId);
00606     *m_Out << "\t";
00607     // Write null coordinates if not defined.
00608     if (m_ClfX >= 0)
00609       *m_Out << m_ClfX;
00610     *m_Out << "\t";
00611     if (m_ClfY >= 0)
00612       *m_Out << m_ClfY;
00613   }
00614   *m_Out << "\n";
00615 }
00616 
00620 void dumpPgf::getCoordsBySequentialClf (const int probeId)
00621 {
00622   m_SequentialClf.getProbeCoordinates (probeId, m_ClfX, m_ClfY);
00623 }
00624 
00628 void dumpPgf::getCoordsByIndex (const int probeId)
00629 {
00630   if (m_ClfTsv.findBegin (0, "probe_id", TSV_OP_EQ, m_PgfProbeId) != TSV_OK)
00631     Err::errAbort ("Problem reading clf file " + m_ClfFileName);
00632   const int resultCount = m_ClfTsv.findResultsCount();
00633   // Fatal error if more than one match was found.
00634   if (resultCount > 1)
00635   {
00636     string msg = "probe_id '" + ToStr (m_PgfProbeId);
00637     msg += "' is not a unique index. Duplicate probe_id found, [";
00638     msg += ToStr (m_PgfProbeId) + "] for clf file " + m_ClfFileName;
00639     Err::errAbort (msg);
00640   }
00641   else if (resultCount == 1)
00642   {
00643     // Found one match - read x, y.
00644     if (m_ClfTsv.findNext() != TSV_OK)
00645       Err::errAbort ("Problem reading clf file " + m_ClfFileName);
00646   }
00647   // Write null x, y coordinates if no match found.
00648   else
00649     m_ClfX = m_ClfY = -1;
00650 }
